commitResults.messageTitle: Added greet, exit and echo functionality to Duke.java
Added add and list functionality to Duke.java
Created new class Task.java
Modified Duke.java to achieve 'mark as done' functionality with Task objects
Task list number changed to be by taskList array index rather than by assigned index at Task creation
Fixed output formatting for Task.java
Removed redundant Task index attribute
Moved setDone() print line and taskList periods from Task.java to Duke.java
Created Todo.java
Created Deadline.java
Created Event.java
Modified Duke.java to handle different types of Tasks
Fix intro text and close Duke.java Scanner for testing purposes
Created AutoUITesting test case in input.txt
Created DukeException.java and added various potential exception outputs
Added try-catch block and invalid input exception handling functionality to Duke.java
Modified Duke and DukeException so that Duke's catch block prints the error message
Added incomplete task input exceptions to Duke
Added exceptions for missing deadline time and event period
Added new exception case and new catch block for NumberFormatException to handle invalid 'done' commands
Reformatted Duke for greater clarity
Reformatted Duke for greater clarity again
Modified Duke to use ArrayList for taskList instead of Task array
Added invalidDelete case for DukeException
Added delete functionality with exception handling to Duke
Modified done and delete functions to throw DukeException when given negative index values
Created DukeExceptionType.java for enumeration of DukeException types
Modified DukeException.java to utilise DukeExceptionType enums
Modified Duke.java to utilise DukeExceptionType enums
Updated Duke functions to handle unnecessary whitespaces
Format to follow Java coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
There are a few standards that the code fails to follow.

Let's,
* fix the switch case indentation
* change boolean name bye to isBye in Duke class
* remove unnecessary this keywords from Event, Deadline, Task classes

Improves readability and follows the standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create hard disk file to save task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Adding the ability to save tasks between separate uses of the program
improves usability, rather than have to start a new task list from
scratch every time.

We start by creating a file 'duke.txt' which acts as the hard disk
in a new directory 'data', and allow Duke to check if the hard disk
exists, create it if not, and access it.

Let's
* create the folder 'data' in the program root folder and the file
'duke.txt' inside 'data' to act as a hard disk and store the task list
* add functionality to Duke to check if 'data' and 'duke.txt' already
exist and create them if they don't already exist
* add exception handling in case the program is unable to create 'data'
and 'duke.txt'

commitResults.messageTitle: Create methods for interacting with hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke needs methods to interact with the hard disk whenever a change
is made to the task list, allowing the hard disk to keep track of them.

Let's create the methods addEntry, setEntryDone, and deleteEntry to
add, delete and set tasks to done on the hard disk.

After this these methods will be implemented into Duke's main function.

There is also a need to abstract out the process of checking duke.txt
upon starting the program, and adding the functionality of loading in
the tasks saved to the hard disk.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement hard disk interaction methods in Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement the methods we added in the previous commit in the Duke
function so any changes to the task list in Duke are reflected in the
hard disk as well.

Also, create a custom string format for the tasks added to the hard
disk for readability.

Finally, add exception cases to DukeException to deal with new potential
exceptions.

Let's
* implement addEntry, setEntryDone and deleteEntry in the add, done
and delete logic of the Duke.main() function
* create a new string format for the different tasks for adding to the
hard disk
* implement new exception cases to deal with potential exceptions
arising from the new methods

commitResults.messageTitle: Create launchDuke function in Duke class
commitResults.messageBody:
To improve readability, abstract out the checking of duke.txt at the
start of the Duke.main() function into a function called launchDuke, and
add to it the loading in of the saved tasks from previous sessions.

Let's
* create the launchDuke function to handle the checking of duke.txt
and inputing of the hard disk's saved tasks into Duke's task list
* add exception case in the event the parsing of tasks from the hard
disk runs into an error (if a task was added in a wrong format etc)

commitResults.messageTitle: Change Deadline to take in LocalDate parameter
commitResults.messageBody:
Allow for Deadline to present deadline in a customised format.

Let's
* modify Deadline and Duke to take in a LocalDate parameter for the
deadline
* add an exception case for what the user-provided deadline parameter
is not in an acceptable format

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow for time to be included in deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
Aside from dates, users may want to include a time in their deadline.
This can be achieved by overloading the Deadline constructor to allow
for a LocalTime parameter to be included.

Let's
* modify Deadline and the implementation of adding deadline tasks
in Duke to allow for users to include a deadline time as well
* modify exception case INVALIDDATE to catch DateTimeParseExceptions
arising from the Deadline constructor taking in a LocalTime parameter

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Event class to take in LocalDate and LocalTime parameters
commitResults.messageBody:
Give users the option of providing dates and times for Event tasks in
the form of LocalDate and LocalTime parameters.

Let's
* overload the Event constructor to allow for the following formats
of Event periods:
1) Start and end dates
2) Start and end times on one day
3) Start date and time, end date and time
* add exception case to deal with the potential exception of invalid
date/time formats

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method isTodayTask for date-based task finding
commitResults.messageBody:
Improve usability by allowing users to find which tasks have a deadline
or event on a certain specified day. First we create methods in the
various task classes that checks if a deadline or event takes place on
that day.

Let's
* convert Task to an abstract class with the abstract isTodayTask method
* implement isTodayTask in Deadline, Event and Todo

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement date-based find function in Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Carrying on from previous commit, creating a find function allows users
to find deadlines or events that take place on a specified day.

Let's
* implement the find functionality in Duke.main()
* create a new exception case to handle the case when users don't give
a date or given a date in the wrong format in the find function
